spacecruiser.name: Genesis II: Space Cruiser
spacecruiser.text:
The year is 2112 and the human race is looking to expand beyond Earth. Despite the mining of nearby asteroids and a multitude of space habitats, natural resources are running low and the population is ever expanding. A group of pioneers travels in search of hospitable planets, resources, and alien life. Their craft is the Genesis II, inspired by marine life, which is capable of acceleration to near light speed. It is equipped with a fleet of scout ships and four larger detachable vessels for more permanent landings.

Renderings are done using marker, pastel, and some Photoshop airbrushing.

bandlink.maintitle: Can you identify all the musical symbols?
bandlink.name: Bandlink Logo
bandlink.text: Bandlink is a music mentoring program where students from the Notre Dame band tutor young musicians. I designed a Bandlink t-shirt design that was sold to students, parents, and mentors of the program as well as a possible logo. The logo is composed of mainly musical symbols and the t-shirt is a monogram filled with words related to music that young musicians would identify with the blue and gold of ND.

irish.name: Irish Dance National Championships Logo
irish.text: This design was for a contest hosted by Irish Dance Magazine for the logo of the Irish Dance Nationals 2012. As an irish dancer and competitor myself, I wanted to emphasize the words irish dance, the silhouttes of the dancers, and the host city of Chicago by referencing the Willis tower. The logo was selected as a top 10 winner.

sixword.name: Six Word Biography
sixword.text: The prompt: describe yourself in exactly six words. Obviously I like to eat as evidenced by the 400 point size EAT but right now you are probably thinking about Reeses Peanut Butter Cups which I did not mention at all. The colors may even have more of an impact than the words themselves. I love peanut butter and chocolate. (which also happens to be six words!)

more_imgs.name: FuturaA.png
more_imgs.caption: Some sample pages - the Futura family

more_imgs.name: FuturaE.png
more_imgs.caption: Only the best font for pizza

futura.name: Type Specimen Book: Futura
futura.text: This short book presents all you need to know about the typeface Futura. Included are history, characteristics, and notable usages. I chose a bright color scheme and a generally humorous writing style to appeal to a general audience. The book was researched, edited, designed, and bound by myself. As a result of this project I now love Futura.The Complete Book PDF

drink.name: Digital Hot Chocolate
drink.text: The goal of the project was to create a CG model of a drink in a transparent container and make it look as real as possible. Using Maya and some reference photos I modeled and textured a glass of hot chocolate (with marshmellows and cinnamon of course!). The scenario: After a long day out in the snow, the viewer is invited to a delicious looking cup of warm cocoa as they look at the window at the mountainside. Rendered using mental ray.

lego.name: Digital LEGO characters
lego.text: Creation of digital lego characters to expand knowledge of Maya. Included modeling, rigging, and texturing to prepare characters for animation. It looks like brickster is getting away with the pizza!

picksix.name: Pick Six
picksix.text: This interactive web app is a small game aimed at exploring symbol sets and the resulting positive and negative space. The user creates six symbols which are each composed of a 9 part tappable grid that changes the corresponding shape of the symbol. The game was designed specifically for iPad using HTML, CSS, and some jQuery. The bold color scheme emphasizes the symbols.Check it out

more_imgs.name: mastermindC.png
more_imgs.caption: Hard mode - up for the challenge?

mastermind.name: Mastermind
mastermind.medium: Interactive Web App (Design and all coding)
mastermind.text: A redesigned version of the classic code breaking game, Mastermind, in which players attempt to figure out a color combination based on feedback from the code setter which in this case is the computer. Muted greys for the background put on emphasis on the focus of the game, brightly colored spheres. The web app is coded entirely in HTML, CSS, and Javascript and fits perfectly on an iPad screen. A Spotify widget is integrated so you can be inspired by some intense instrumental tunes while you play. See if you can beat the hard mode!Play the game (Try it on an iPad!)GitHub

mysite.name: This website
mysite.text: This started off as a small school project and turned into a way for me to tackle new web technologies and brand myself online. It has been recently updated to be responsive which required a mobile/tablet redesign process and complete overhaul. Technologies used include HTML5 (incl. canvas), CSS, Javascript, JQuery, and JSON as well as the integration and modification of several third party scripts incluing swipe.js, lettering.js, and jMyCarousel.

more_imgs.name: Ready.png

paramount.name: Paramount Plastics Interface
paramount.text: Paramount Plastics, a vacuum forming plastic company located in Northern Indiana, was in need of a new control interface for one of their machines. To eliminate problems of readability ease worker stress, and improve productivity my web design class explored an iPad interface. We first visited the company to gather research and then made interactive web app prototypes to present to workers that would potentially use the machines. This is my take on an interface redesign for iPad. The white on dark improves readability and the streamlined process eliminates unnecessary steps and chances of error.View the presentation for the clientGitHub

figure.text: Drawings of the figure both from life and slides with a focus on proportion and edge quality.

technical.name: Product Drawings
technical.text: Technical drawings using a variety of rendering techniques and mediums including pencil, pen, sharpie, pastel, and marker. Samples from redesigns/studies of a drill, hairdryer, desktop speaker, space cruiser, and power tool.
